tuv.seg: Coming from the EU/EEA to work
Ag teacht ón AE/LEE chun oibriú
As an EU national you are entitled to come to Ireland to take up employment or self-employment
Mar shaoránach de chuid an Limistéir Eorpaigh Eacnamaíoch (LEE) tá tú i dteideal teacht go hÉirinn chun gabháil d’fhostaíocht nó d’fhéinfhostaíocht
You do not need an employment permit
Ní gá duit cead fostaíochta a fháil
Nationals from the other countries of the European Economic Area (EEA), that is, Norway, Iceland and Liechtenstein, and Switzerland do not need employment permits to work in Ireland
Ní gá do shaoránaigh as na tíortha eile de chuid an LEE (an Iorua, an Íoslann agus Lichtinstéin) agus de chuid na hEilvéise ceadanna fostaíochta a fháil chun dul i mbun oibre in Éirinn

If you are an EEA or Swiss national you and your family members have the right to come to Ireland for 3 months with no conditions attached under the European Communities (Free Movement of Persons) Regulations 2015 which implement an EU Directive on the free movement of persons

Más náisiúnach de chuid an AE/LEE nó de chuid na hEilvéise tú tá an ceart agat agus ag na daoine de do theaghlach teacht go hÉirinn ar feadh 3 mhí gan aon choinníollacha a bheith ag gabháil leis mar go ndearnadh dlí de Rialacháin 2015 (Saorghluaiseacht Daoine) na gComhphobal Eorpach, lena gcuirtear Treoir de chuid an AE maidir le saorghluaiseacht daoine i ngníomh
You then have the right of residence for longer than 3 months if:
Tá ceart cónaithe agat ansin go ceann tréimhse is faide ná 3 mhí más rud é:
• You are employed or self-employed
• Go bhfuil tú ag obair nó go bhfuil tú féinfhostaithe
• You have enough resources so that you and your dependants do not become a burden on the social assistance system and you have comprehensive sickness insurance
• Go bhfuil go leor acmhainní agat ionas nach dtiocfaidh tú agus do chleithiúnaithe chun bheith ina n-ualach ar an gcóras um chúnamh sóisialach agus go bhfuil árachas cuimsitheach breoiteachta agat
• You are a student, you can maintain yourself, you have a place in an educational institution and you have sickness insurance
• Gur mac léinn tú, gur féidir leat tú féin a chothú, go bhfuil áit agat in institiúid oideachais agus go bhfuil árachas breoiteachta agat
EEA and Swiss nationals are not required to register with the immigration authorities
Ní cheanglaítear ar náisiúnaigh de chuid an AE/LEE nó de chuid na hEilvéise clárú leis na húdaráis inimirce
Family members of EU citizens who are not themselves EEA or Swiss nationals are required to register with the immigration authorities and apply for a residence card under EU Treaty Rights

Ceanglaítear ar dhaoine de theaghlaigh saoránach de chuid an AE nach náisiúnaigh iad féin de chuid an AE/LEE nó de chuid na hEilvéise a chlárú leis na húdaráis um inimirce agus cárta cónaithe de réir cearta Chonradh AE a fháil
You can read more in our document on the residence rights of EEA nationals
Tá tuilleadh faisnéise faoi chearta cónaithe náisiúnach de chuid an AE/LEE ar fáil
If you are an Irish citizen who has worked in another EEA country and are returning to Ireland, you are officially a migrant worker under EU legislation
Más saoránach Éireannach thú ag filleadh ar an tír seo agus má bhí tú ag obair i dtír eile den AE is oibrí inimirce thú go hoifigiúil de réir dlí an AE
This means that, among other things, your social security rights are extensively affected by EU Regulations
Dá bharr seo, i measc rudaí eile, tá tionchar an-mhór ag Rialacha an AE ar na cearta leasa shóisialaigh atá agat
If you are unemployed, your unemployment benefit in the country you are leaving may be transferred after you have been receiving it for 4 weeks
Má tá tú dífhostaithe, ba cheart duit iarratas ar shochar dífhostaíochta a dhéanamh sa tír atá á agat fágáil agus ansin é a fháil aistrithe go hÉirinn
Under EU Regulations you can ask for it to be transferred to Ireland and you should bring a copy of the form U2 (which is replacing form E303) with details of your payment
Faoi Rialacháin AE is féidir an sochar a aistriú agus ba chóir duit an fhoirm U2 (E303 roimhe seo) le sonraí do chuid íocaíocht a thabhairt
You must, of course, comply with the rules for getting benefit in the country that you are leaving
Beidh ort na rialacha atá i bhfeidhm sa tír sin i dtaobh sochar dífhostaíochta a shásamh
When you arrive in Ireland, you should sign on at your local social welfare office - see 'Where to apply' below within a week
Nuair a thagann tú go hÉirinn ba cheart duit síniú ag an oifig áitiúil leasa shóisialaigh - féach 'Cá háit a dhéanfaidh mé iarratas' thíos
You may then receive your benefit for 13 weeks (up to 26 weeks in some cases)
Cuirfear sochar ar fáil ansin duit ar feadh 13 seachtain (suas go 26 seachtain i gcasanna áirithe)
You get the same benefit as you would get if you stayed in the country you have left
Gheobhaidh tú an sochar céanna agus a bhí ar fáil duit sa tír ina raibh tú
You are entitled to medical card services in Ireland while you are receiving unemployment benefit from the other country
Tá sé de cheart agat seirbhísí cárta leighis in Éirinn a bheith agat an fhad agus atá sochar díofhostaíochta dhá fháil agat ó thír eile
After 13 weeks have expired, you will be in the normal Irish social welfare system
Tar éis 13 seachtain titfidh tú faoin ngnáthchóras leasa shóisialaigh in Éirinn
In order to qualify for benefits in Ireland, you need to get a job and pay at least one Class A PRSI contribution
Beidh ort post a fháil in Éirinn agus ranníocaíocht amháin ar a laghad ag Aicme A den chóras ÁSPC a íoc le bheith i dteideal sochair
At this point, your contributions from the other country you worked in may be added to your Irish contribution(s) to help you qualify for benefits
Ag an bpointe sin cuirfear na ranníocaíochtaí ón tír eile le chéile leis an ranníocaíocht Éireannach ar mhaithe le sochair a chur ar fáil duit
When you are coming to Ireland you should bring a record of your contributions on Forms U1 (formerly E301) and E104 from the social security institution in the country you are leaving

Nuair atá tú ag filleadh ar Éirinn ba cheart duit fianaise ar na híocaíochtaí atá déanta agat a thabhairt leat ar Foirmeacha U1 (E301 roimhe seo) agus E104 ón institiúid leasa shóisialaigh sa tír ina bhfuil tú ag fágáil
These forms will help speed up the payment of benefits under EU Regulations
Beidh an próiséas le sochair a íoc faoi rialacha an AE i bhfad níos tapúla má tá na foirmeacha sin agat
If you are employed when you come to Ireland then you are covered by the normal Irish rules relating to social welfare
Más fostaí thú nuair a thagann tú ar ais go hÉirinn beidh tú clúdaithe faoi na gnáthrialacha leasa shóisialaigh in Éirinn

Under EU Regulations, EEA and Swiss citizens and non-EEA nationals who have previously worked in another EEA state, are exempt from the habitual residence condition for family benefits provided they are employed or self-employed in Ireland and subject to the Irish social welfare system

Faoi Rialacháin AE, má tá saoránaigh de chuid LEE nó na hEilvéise agus náisiúnaigh neamh-LEE a d’oibrigh i stát LEE eile roimhe sin, fostaithe nó féinfhostaithe in Éirinn agus má tá siad páirteach i gcóras Árachas Sóisialta na hÉireann, tá siad díolmhaithe ón gcoinníoll maidir le gnáthchónaí chun sochair theaghlaigh a fháil

EEA workers will satisfy the habitual residence condition for Supplementary Welfare Allowance but people from the EU/EEA who move to Ireland in search of employment are subject to the habitual residence test in the normal way while looking for work

Is féidir oibrithe de chuid AE/ LEE nó na hEilvéise an coinníoll maidir le gnáthchónaí a shásamh chun Liúntas Leasa Forlíontach a fháil. Maidir le saoránaigh de chuid LEE nó na hEilvéise a thagann go hÉirinn ag cuardach fostaíochta, áfach, ní mór dóibh an Coinníoll maidir le Gnáthchónaí a shásamh fad is atá siad ag lorg oibre
Rights while working in Ireland
Do chearta agus tú ag obair in Éirinn
As an EEA national working in Ireland, you are entitled to exactly the same rights as Irish citizens with regard to social welfare, employment rights and social rights in general

Mar shaoránach den AE/CEE atá ag obair in Éirinn tá tú i dteideal na cearta ceanna agus atá saoránaigh Éireannacha faoin gcóras leasa shóisialaigh, mar aon le cearta fostaíochta agus sóisialta go ginearálta
As soon as you come to Ireland you should register for tax and social insurance by applying for a Personal Public Service (PPS) number
Nuair a thagann tú go hÉirinn ba cheart duit iarratas a dhéanamh ar uimhir Phearsanta Seirbhíse Poiblí chun chlárú ar chursaí cánach agus árachas sóisialta
If you need help finding a job in Ireland you can get advice on employment and training opportunities from your local employment services office
Má bíonn cabhair chun post a fháil ag teastáil uait, is féidir leat comhairle faoi dheiseanna fostaíochta agus oideachais ó d'oifig seirbhísí fostaiochta áitiúil a fháil
If you are posted here by your employer on a temporary basis, you are entitled to the equivalent of medical card services
Má chuireann do fhostóir anseo thú go sealadach tá tú i dteideal na seirbhísí céanna agus atá daoine le cártaí leighis
If you are employed or self-employed and staying on a permanent basis, you come under the same rules for entitlement to health services as Irish nationals generally
Má tá tú fostaithe nó féin-fhostaithe agus ag fanacht go buan, baineann na rialacha céanna leat maidir le cearta seirbhísí sláinte agus a bhaineann le saoránaigh Éireannacha go ginearálta
Therefore, you must pass a means test to get a medical card
Mar sin, beidh ort scrúdú maoine a shásamh le cárta leighis a fháil
Contact your local social welfare office or Intreo centre
Déan teaghmháil leis an oifig áitiúil leasa shóisialaigh nó ionad Intreo
